Visualization Index¶

class Visualization(traces)¶

create all step for the visualization

Arguments:
  • traces (TraceList) – list of all traces
Visualization.addNewPointerAndVisualizeIt(changeObject)¶

Adds new pointer to the visualized linked list.

Arguments:
  • changeObject (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on list nodes
Visualization.add_nodesToTheList(current, next, changeObject, pointerChange)¶

Adds a node the the current Visualized linked list and visualize the addition

Arguments:
  • current (VisualizationStep) – the current visualization step
  • next (VisualizationStep) – the next visualization step
  • changeObject (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on list nodes
  • pointerChange (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on pointers
Visualization.correctPointersForVisualization(nextStep)¶

modify the pointers references and pointee location for the next step

Arguments:
  • nextStep (VisualizationStep) – the next step to be used to correct the pointers in the current visualized linked list
Visualization.determineTheChange(diff)¶

use the diff to identify the changes. The changes are in the form of Json object string

Visualization.drawFinalState()¶

Draws the final configuration

Visualization.drawInitialState()¶

Draws the initial configuration

Visualization.getCurrentStep()¶

returns the current step

Visualization.getNextStep()¶
1- check change in the linked list number, values, order
2- check change in pointers pointee (becomes null), position, add new pointer return the step with the next step with the change or the last step (return statement step)
Visualization.getStep(index)¶

returns the specified step based on the given index

Arguments:
  • index (Integer) – the step index
Visualization.movePointer(pointerIndex, toIndex)¶

move a pointer based on its index inside the list of pointers for a step, to any position in the linked list

Arguments:
  • pointerIndex (Integer) – pointer index inside the list of pointers for a step
  • toIndex (Integer) – the index for a node in the Linked list to be pointed by the pointer
Visualization.movePointerToSeparateNode(pointerIndex, node, nodeReference)¶

function to make pointer pointes to a node that is not in the list

Visualization.nullifyPointer(pointerIndex)¶

Make the pointer value to null and visualize it appropriately

Arguments:
  • pointerIndex (Integer) – the index of the pointer
Visualization.remove_nodesFromTheList(current, next, changeObject, pointerChange)¶

There is a change in the number of nodes inside the list. So, we need to detect, apply and visualize the change

Arguments:
  • current (VisualizationStep) – the current visualization step
  • next (VisualizationStep) – the next visualization step
  • changeObject (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on list nodes
  • pointerChange (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on pointers
Visualization.resetSteps()¶

reset the current step value

Visualization.size()¶

returns the total number of steps

Visualization.visualizeAllSteps()¶

Visualizes all steps.

Visualization.visualizeChanges(current, next)¶

Visualize the change from the current step to the next step

Arguments:
  • current (VisualizationStep) – the current step
  • next (VisualizationStep) – the next step
Visualization.visualizeLinkedListNodes(current, next, changeObject)¶

Visualizes the change in the order of nodes (next values), or the values of nodes

Arguments:
  • current (VisualizationStep) – the current visualization step
  • next (VisualizationStep) – the next visualization step
  • changeObject (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on list nodes
Visualization.visualizePointers(current, changeObject)¶

Visualizes the pointers based on the current visualization step

Arguments:
  • current (VisualizationStep) – the current visualization step
  • changeObject (Hash) – Hash table that contains the changes to be applied on pointers
